attributes.action: stop pretending to give a monkeys what the electorate think
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Democracy these days seems to be more about being seen to be doing something, rather than actually doing anything!

Symptomatic of this malaise, is the fact that over a million people have signed the petition to prevent more taxes on car users and despite this, the government plans to 'press on'.

This petitioner thinks that this website is entirely pointless if popular petitions are ignored.  

This government seems to ignore the electorate in everything they do from privatising the NHS to taxing us for wiping our dirty bottoms.

I would therefore like to petition the PM to scrap this useless website, as what is the point of having the e-petitions if they are merely a pretence at giving a monkeys?

Why doesn't he just carry on regardless and stop pretending he gives a monkeys?  

(at least then we'd save the cash cost to run this ridiculous pretence at caring)
(ps thanks for pretending to care Tony)

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
